intro: Hibbertia trichocalyx, commonly known as the golden hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with prominent central stamens. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring narrow, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Hibbertia trichocalyx is adapted to dry environments and is often found in sandy soils across southeastern Australia. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
